original: 3.The Master Franchise Agreement contains covenants not to compete which extend beyond the termination of the agreement. These provisions may not be enforceable under California law.
ollama_generated: 3. While the Master Franchise Agreement includes non-compete covenants that persist after the termination of this agreement, it is acknowledged that these terms may face challenges in their enforcement under California law. The parties agree to strive for a resolution should such issues arise.

original: 6.The Master Franchise Agreement requires non-binding mediation. The mediation will occur in New York with the costs being borne by equally by the parties. Prospective franchisees are encouraged to consult private legal counsel to determine the applicability of California and federal laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) to any provisions of a franchise agreement restricting venue to a forum outside the State of California.
ollama_generated: 6. The Franchise Agreement includes a non-compulsory mediation process, which shall take place in New York at the mutual expense and convenience of both parties. It is strongly recommended that potential franchisees seek independent legal advice to assess whether provisions within the franchise agreement that may restrict venue to a forum outside California comply with relevant California state laws (such as Business and Professions Code Section 20040.5 and Code of Civil Procedure Section 1281) or federal regulations. While mediation is not mandatory, failure to reach an agreement through this process may result in the matter being taken to court, subject to the jurisdiction of New York courts.

original: 7.The Master Franchise Agreement requires application of the laws of New York. This provision may not be enforceable under California law.
ollama_generated: 7. This Master Franchise Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, except to the extent that such laws may be preempted or invalidated by applicable federal laws or the laws of the jurisdiction where the Franchisee is located. In the event that any provision of this Agreement conflicts with such local laws, the parties shall cooperate in good faith to amend the conflicting provisions so as to achieve the original intent of the parties while complying with the requirements of the applicable law.

original: 9.THE CALIFORNIA FRANCHISE INVESTMENT LAW REQUIRES THAT A COPY OF ALL PROPOSED AGREEMENTS RELATING TO THE SALE OF THE FRANCHISE BE DELIVERED TOGETHER WITH THE DISCLOSURE DOCUMENT.
ollama_generated: 9. Under the California Franchise Investment Law, it is incumbent upon us to provide you with a copy of all proposed agreements pertaining to the sale of the franchise, coincident with the delivery of the disclosure document. This means that you will receive the agreements at approximately the same time as the disclosure document, but not necessarily beforehand.
